Current mood.

Wed, Feb 21, 2018 at 12:04pm

I’m coding a nice new feature for SwiftoDo tonight. Hopefully it will be done tomorrow or Thursday, and I can get it in users hands by next weekend. Line 8 in the screenshot is new.

Tue, Feb 20, 2018 at 11:37pm

🚀 I finally installed Rocket on my Mac. It’s a lot nicer to use than Character Viewer (Control+Command+Space) to drop emoji into text boxes.

🎙 This week’s episode had me Googling for ‘longest episode of “The Talk Show” with John Gruber ever’.

Blog post: A/B/C testing: “August and Everything After”, in 24-bit, 96kHz FLAC vs. 16-bit, 44.1kHz ALAC vs. 256 kbps AAC

Mon, Feb 19, 2018 at 08:59am

🎵 If you like The Weakerthans as much as I do, you will find this interview with their singer, John K. Samson, fascinating.

Sat, Feb 17, 2018 at 11:46pm

We had an enormous house party today. It was a lot of fun, but boy are we wiped out! 🎈

Sat, Feb 17, 2018 at 07:48pm

🎬 I saw “Thor: Ragnarok” today and thoroughly enjoyed it. The “Thor” and “Captain America” series started off a little weak but ended up much stronger than the “Iron Man” series, which had the opposite trajectory. It’s upsetting that they never made a “Black Widow” movie series.

Fri, Feb 16, 2018 at 10:20pm

Another SwiftoDo update will come at the end of next week, as long as I can get the timing right with App Store review. I cannot promise weekly updates forever, but right now I am trying to release the best version possible to my users, as soon as possible.

Fri, Feb 16, 2018 at 09:35pm

SwiftoDo 2.8.0 is now available in the App Store. It adds a picker to make adding recurrence pattern tags (for daily, weekly, monthly, etc.) to tasks easier. It also lets you drop tasks onto the task list from other apps (iPad only).

Fri, Feb 16, 2018 at 12:13pm

I am listening to music from my MacBook Pro today, via the Oppo HA-2SE. One benefit is that it charges through its micro USB input, so playtime is unlimited. iTunes is slower and buggier than the iOS Music app, though.

Thu, Feb 15, 2018 at 02:20pm

Adding my Nest thermostat to HomeKit via HomeBridge has made my life a little better. I do have a suggestion for Apple, though: “Hey Siri, set thermostat to 70º F and let no one in my family change it, ever, for any reason.” Maybe I don’t need a smart thermostat after all.

Thu, Feb 15, 2018 at 10:09am

I downloaded Visual Studio Code on my Windows work machine today. I don’t see how it will be better than Sublime Text for me however. I mostly need speed and some extensibility, and don’t need to compile or debug so much.

Wed, Feb 14, 2018 at 08:20pm

My wife baked a delicious Valentine’s Day treat. ❤️😄

Wed, Feb 14, 2018 at 07:44pm

Blog post: My Slide into Audiophile Territory, Part 1

Wed, Feb 14, 2018 at 09:25am

Tonight I set up HomeBridge on an otherwise unused Raspberry Pi to control my Nest thermostat via Siri and HomeKit. The hardest part for me was getting it set up as a service, because I hadn’t used systemd before. I blame/thank FreeBSD for that!

Tue, Feb 13, 2018 at 11:49pm

If Apple really is slowing down and fixing bugs, rather than adding features, I wish they would work more on Xcode 9, which is still a mess for me for Swift development.

Tue, Feb 13, 2018 at 09:37am

I’m coding a user-requested feature this evening. I started really late after a 2-hour trip to Wegmans. I stayed up to do a particularly satisfying refactor.

Mon, Feb 12, 2018 at 11:49pm

I may be helping out my employer with podcasting in the next few months. It is surprising to me that they are interested in podcasting. For them, it’s about owning content, and about it being evergreen, rather than ephemeral, like webinars. It would be fun to help out with it.

Mon, Feb 12, 2018 at 01:10pm

🎙 It’s Monday morning, so I am listening to “This Week in Tech”.
